fxInfo_clarification: Leave blank if there is no upper chamber.
fxInfo_question: Are ballots in elections for the upper chamber of the national legislature counted differently for different social groups? (Check all that apply.)

fxInfo_responses.value: No. All ballots are counted equally, regardless of social group.
Yes. There is a curial/estate voting system where voters are separated into categories by, for example, class criteria and assigned a disproportionate numbers of deputies.
Yes. There is census/plural vote for particular groups (e.g., votes cast by individuals with higher incomes or tax contributions are given more weight)
Yes. Some voters are allowed to vote in several constituencies.
